title: Why I Create
excerpt: Art helps me say things when words don’t. A blank page is where I figure out what I really feel.
content:
Art helps me say things when words don’t. A blank page is where I figure out what I really feel.

Creating feels like sorting through thoughts — deciding what stays and what doesn’t. In the studio, I learn to choose. The canvas shows me where I’m headed.

This year, I’m slowing down. Letting shapes meet by accident, letting colors surprise me, and treating pauses as part of the process.

title: The Beauty of Imperfection
excerpt: Perfection shuts things down. Imperfection leaves room to breathe and grow.
content:
Perfection shuts things down. Imperfection leaves room to breathe and grow.

A lot of my favorite pieces started as mistakes — a drip, a messy edge, paint where I didn’t plan it. Instead of fixing everything right away, I respond and keep going.

Art reminds me that the 'fixed' places, the little repairs, are part of the story. Those spots show care and attention.

title: On Color and Memory
excerpt: Some colors feel like places I’ve been. They show up suddenly, like a warm room in late afternoon.
content:
Some colors feel like places I’ve been. They show up suddenly, like a warm room in late afternoon.

I keep a small list of colors I notice in real life — brick at sunset, rainy moss, the soft blue of early mornings. When I’m stuck on a piece, I return to that list for inspiration.

Memory is one of my best creative tools.
